subject: IGCSE Physics

overview.description: Cambridge IGCSE Physics curriculum designed to develop understanding of physical concepts, practical skills, and scientific inquiry for students pursuing international qualifications

learning_objectives: Understand fundamental physics concepts and principles
Develop practical and investigative skills in physics
Apply physics knowledge to explain everyday phenomena
Prepare for further study in physics and related sciences
Develop scientific literacy and critical thinking skills

units.title: Forces and Motion
learning_outcomes: Understand concepts of distance, speed, velocity, and acceleration
Apply Newton's laws of motion to solve problems
Analyze forces and their effects on motion
Investigate motion using practical experiments

lessons.title: Investigating Motion with Data Loggers
objectives: Use data loggers to measure and analyze motion
Calculate speed, velocity, and acceleration from experimental data
Interpret motion graphs and their physical significance

activities.description: Use motion sensors and data loggers to investigate different types of motion
Analyze motion data and create velocity-time and acceleration-time graphs
Interpret graphs to understand physical meaning of motion
Discuss findings and connect to real-world motion examples

cross_curricular_connections: Technology: Use of sensors and digital tools

units.title: Energy, Work and Power
learning_outcomes: Understand different forms of energy and energy transformations
Apply conservation of energy principle to solve problems
Calculate work done and power in various situations
Investigate energy efficiency in practical contexts

lessons.title: Energy Efficiency Investigation
objectives: Investigate energy efficiency in different systems
Calculate efficiency using energy input and output measurements

activities.description: Investigate efficiency of pulleys, inclined planes, and electrical devices
Calculate efficiency values and compare different systems
Discuss ways to improve energy efficiency in various applications
Connect findings to energy efficiency in homes and industry

cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Cost-benefit analysis of energy systems

units.title: Waves and Sound
learning_outcomes: Understand wave properties and behavior
Investigate sound waves and their characteristics
Apply wave principles to explain phenomena
Use wave equations to solve problems

lessons.title: Wave Properties and Sound Investigation
objectives: Investigate properties of waves using wave tanks and oscilloscopes
Measure wavelength, frequency, and speed of waves
Understand wave reflection, refraction, and interference

activities.description: Use wave tanks to investigate wave properties and behaviors
Use oscilloscopes and microphones to analyze sound waves
Apply wave equation v = fÎ» to solve wave problems
Explain everyday wave phenomena using wave principles

cross_curricular_connections: Music: Sound waves and musical instruments

units.title: Electricity and Magnetism
learning_outcomes: Understand electrical circuits and component behavior
Apply Ohm's law and electrical power calculations
Investigate magnetic fields and electromagnetic effects
Understand electromagnetic induction and its applications

lessons.title: Circuit Analysis and Component Characteristics
objectives: Investigate I-V characteristics of different circuit components
Apply Ohm's law and power equations to circuit analysis
Understand series and parallel circuit behavior

activities.description: Investigate I-V characteristics of resistors, diodes, and filament lamps
Build and analyze series and parallel circuits
Apply electrical equations to solve circuit problems
Discuss applications in household and electronic devices

units.title: Atomic Physics and Radioactivity
learning_outcomes: Understand atomic structure and nuclear physics
Investigate radioactive decay and radiation types
Apply half-life concepts to solve problems
Understand applications and safety of radioactivity

lessons.title: Radioactivity and Half-Life Investigation
objectives: Investigate properties of different types of radiation
Understand radioactive decay and half-life concepts
Apply half-life calculations to solve problems

activities.description: Use Geiger counters to detect and investigate radiation properties
Use simulations to understand radioactive decay and half-life
Solve half-life problems and decay calculations
Discuss radiation safety and beneficial applications

assessment_criteria: Understanding of atomic and nuclear concepts (35%)
cross_curricular_connections: Chemistry: Atomic structure and nuclear chemistry

core_practicals: Electrical circuit analysis and component characteristics
assessment_practicals: Conducting experiments with accuracy and precision
Analyzing data and drawing evidence-based conclusions
Evaluating experimental methods and suggesting improvements

assessment_objectives: AO2: Handling information and problem solving

formative_assessments: Weekly practical reports and data analysis
Progressive topic tests using past paper questions

textbooks: IGCSE Physics Past Papers and Mark Schemes
